metadata.synopsis:
The goblin king is about to conduct a ceremony in which he speak's with a mind flayer's dead body. He is a hobgoblin on a power trip, but still devoted to his god The Absolute. Like most goblins, he's not greatly intelligent, but a cut above the rest.

Pronunciation: Dror Ragzlin = Drawer RAGS-lin.

Z'Rell = Zuh-RELL. Other prinunciations in actor node field. 

Goblin language words should sound guttural and trashy.When they engage with Ragzlin, the player will experience a brief vision of him with an elf - this is teasing Ketheric Thorm, a later antagonist. Ragzlin will say he's looking for a weapon - the place will realise via narrator or mindmeld with Shadowheart that this is the gith artefact that she has.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach Dror Ragzlin in the Goblin Camp:- loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto 295.11, 40.95, 36.01

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Goblins and drow, working together. But why?

2.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
2.text: The Absolute's got room for everyone long as you don't defy Her. And nobody's that stupid.

76.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
76.text: If the Absolute says to take orders from a drow, then we toe the mark, no questions.

372.speaker: Player
372.text: I'm in need of a healer.

378.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
378.text: You look spiffy to me. What d'you need a healer for?

326.speaker: Player
326.text: Tell the truth. The mind flayers, the parasite - all of it.

250.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
250.text: You're no True Soul. You're a damned heretic.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: I'm closing some gaps in my group. Everyone needs a healer.

374.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
374.text: Well, let me know when you find one. Priestess Gut's better at causing pain than curing it.

267.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
267.text: Not the time for it, hear?

296.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
296.text: Shuugaan, a shuulkac. O taash okec dor.
296.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: "Shoe-gone, ah shool-cock. Oh tosh o-keck door."

128.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
128.text: I command you, corpse: speak! Reveal truth to the Absolute!

376.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on mind flayer corpse, which doesn't move.[Custom cameras required]

221.speaker: Lae'zel
221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looks at the mind flayer corpseNodeContext: For Lae'zel: Ghaik = GAYK.

237.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
237.text: Nothing. Must be reading it wrong!

245.speaker: Wyll
245.text: This is the big boss. Strike him down.
245.context: NodeContext: Not too loud, just forceful.

255.speaker: Narrator
255.text: *The hobgoblin turns to you, and the parasite squirms in your skull.*
255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should turn to player.

270.speaker: Narrator
270.text: *You taste the ale on his tongue and the bile in his soul.*

303.speaker: Narrator
303.text: *The visions cloud your inner eye for a brief moment once again. You see the hobgoblin, bowing before the armoured elf you'd glimpsed before.*
303.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to experiencing a mindmeldInternalNodeContext: Referring to a glimpse of Dror with Ketheric, one of the dead tribunal. This narrator node will ultimately be replaced or complimented by cinematics, once the necessary assets are available. This elaborates on a vision experienced during the 'Voice of Absolute' scene, which occurs before this on entering the goblin camp.

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *The elf speaks of the hunt for a great weapon, and the rewards that will go to whoever finds it. The hobgoblin's eyes gleam hungrily.*
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to experiencing a mindmeld

450.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
450.text: Well, look here. A True Soul halfling. A long way from home, aren't you?

86.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
86.text: Never saw a True Soul like you. But you got the Absolute's blessing.

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *He doesn't speak his next words, yet they still rattle your skull from within.*

387.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
387.text: You ever talk to a dead squid? Now's your chance.
387.context: CinematicNodeContext: This shouldn't be lip synched. Dror Ragzlin is speaking into your mind.InternalNodeContext: Sound effect: He is talking telepathically.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: I haven't made a habit of it.

289.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
289.text: No time like the present, eh?

170.speaker: Player
170.text: What kind of ceremony is this?

297.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
297.text: Guess you're a thick one, so I'll tell it straight: we're gonna make the carcass talk.

213.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
213.text: Absolute says the dead squiddie had a weapon. I reckon the killer nabbed it and scooted off to that looter camp.

72.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
72.text: We find who killed it, and we find who took that weapon. So settle in.

396.speaker: Narrator
396.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon the Absolute seeks - it's the artefact that she carries. The same one that protected you as you entered the goblin camp.*
396.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

282.speaker: Narrator
282.text: *Her mind focuses - their suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is within their grasp.*
282.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to Dror Ragzlin.

269.context: CinematicNodeContext: The other companions share looks with each other - they've all picked up on Shadowheart's warning. Tav realises Dror is waiting for them.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: All right. Let the ceremony proceed.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: Study the corpse. Was this the mind flayer that tortured you?

177.speaker: Narrator
177.text: *Your skull sizzles with Ragzlin's displeasure. His mouth is still, yet you hear his demand.*

327.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
327.text: I speak for the Absolute. And I say you stay.
327.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is a telepathic line, so no lip syncing.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Study the mind flayer. Could it be...?

293.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera should examine the mind flayer corpse. [Custom camera]

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *This mind flayer's build is smaller, its garb plainer - a fearsome creature even in death, but not the one that tormented you.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Yet it, too, roamed the nautiloid. It would have seen you, known you...*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I know this magic. Hand me the scroll and I can do the talking.

12.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
12.text: Then take it. Absolute knows I'm not getting anywhere.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *You read aloud the words on the scroll.*
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king gives player a speak with dead scroll, and player reads the spell.

426.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
426.text: Damn it. I saw it, too. And it tells me nothing!

451.speaker: Player
451.text: Why were the gith chasing the ship?

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *Suspicion floods Ragzlin's mind. Your brain howls as you consider your final question.*

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Why were the gith chasing the ship?

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *Ragzlin's mind rages. You have asked what no True Soul would dare.*

345.speaker: Narrator
345.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod. Darkness clears to reveal a face: yours.*

131.speaker: Player
131.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *Curiosity conquers the hobgoblin's suspicions. You suck in a breath of relief...*

392.speaker: Narrator
392.text: *...and visions consume you once more. A swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *Doubt clouds Ragzlin's skull. Might he suspect the truth?*

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

381.speaker: Narrator
381.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised once more by a question he didn't expect...*
381.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Ragzlin frowns at a question he would never have asked.*
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look susprised here.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *You feel Ragzlin's suspicions. A True Soul should never ask about the Master.*

273.speaker: Player
273.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *Ragzlin scowls, shocked by a question you shouldn't have asked, and a jolt shoots through you.*
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look surprised here.

91.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
91.text: I saw it, too. Gith on the hunt. They know something...

262.speaker: Player
262.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

149.speaker: Narrator
149.text: *Your skull sizzles with Ragzlin's displeasure. His mouth is still, but you hear his demand.*

446.speaker: Player
446.text: It seems to me you've got an audience already.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I'm staying. Go on with the ceremony.

214.speaker: Narrator
214.text: *You choke on black smoke as the hobgoblin bellows his incantation.*

41.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
41.text: I command you, corpse: speak and say sooth. Lhuuc an ac akuul'dec shuulkokec!
41.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation; "Luke an ock a-cool-deck shool-ko-keck."

332.speaker: Narrator
332.text: *The hideous corpse rises, tentacles writhing. The creature from the wreckage...*

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *Your heart seizes. Under questioning, the creature might recognise you as its killer.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Your heart seizes. What if the creature noted your presence at the crash site?*

423.speaker: Player
423.text: Allow the hobgoblin to speak freely, lest he sense your intrusion.

279.speaker: Player
279.text: Dig into Ragzlin's mind and control the interrogation.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Ragzlin's mind reels, then calms. He will speak as you command.*

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *Ragzlin remains composed. If he senses your manipulations, he gives no sign.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *The creature responds - not in words, but memories.*

440.speaker: Narrator
440.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod - devoid of flesh, only darkness.*
440.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

316.speaker: Narrator
316.text: *Ragzlin remains ignorant to your presence in his mindmurk. You choose your next question:*

313.speaker: Player
313.text: 'Why were the gith chasing that ship?'

244.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
244.text: Why were the gith chasing that ship?

350.speaker: Narrator
350.text: *You see dark tunnels lit by noxious pools of brine. The darkness spreads through the earth.*

340.speaker: Narrator
340.text: *The sky splits open, and nautiloids pour out of a void that consumes the stars.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *You see an image: curved drow blades, crude goblin torches, gnoll teeth dripping blood.*

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *Again, a vision comes to you. A memory, seen through the creature's soul-dead eyes.*
174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here

84.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
84.text: You're kidding me! Very helpful, squid.

195.speaker: Narrator
195.text: *Suspicion floods Ragzlin's mind. Your brain howls as you force a final query into his throat.*

102.speaker: Player
102.text: 'Why were the gith chasing that ship?'

355.speaker: Narrator
355.context: InternalNodeContext: Sound effects should def. sound like a series of smacks on the floor when the tentacles fall.

272.speaker: Narrator
272.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod to reveal a face. Yours.*

256.speaker: Narrator
256.text: *Irritation eclipses his suspicions and Ragzlin's mind rests.*

390.speaker: Narrator
390.text: *Curiosity conquers his suspicions. You suck in a breath of relief...*

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *...and visions consume you once more. A swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

441.speaker: Narrator
441.text: *Visions consume you once more - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *Ragzlin pierces your mind, prodding for truth.*

190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ragzlin looks at you, and then anger comes over him.

298.speaker: Player
298.text: I would never deceive the Absolute's Right Hand.

158.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
158.text: Right Hand, eh? Sounds like word's spreading!

21.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
21.text: You're right. You're a real True Soul. I felt it.

247.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
247.text: Riddles, all of it. And nothing to show for the trouble but rotting squid meat.

448.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
448.text: No answers, no killer, and no damned weapon!

399.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king looks away, pauses, then looks at you with a creepy smile.

11.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
11.text: One failure to the next. Absolute'll have my damned head.

234.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
234.text: Now get out, before I get the itch to take yours.

74.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
74.text: The damned drow was right. And now she'll be grabbing the glory.

148.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
148.text: You still here? Get yourself gone, before I show you my temper.

301.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
301.text: Hmph. The damned drow was right. Can't let her get all the glory.

398.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
398.text: The raid's started already. Let's hope she's in trouble and needs help.

217.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
217.text: You - get to the grove. Help the drow Minthara kill the lot.

189.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
189.text: Well don't just stand there. Move!

386.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
386.text: Like I said - I got plans for you. Report to the drow. Minthara's the name.

317.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
317.text: Seems I ain't done with you. Report to the drow. Minthara's the name.

442.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
442.text: She's mounting an attack on that blasted grove. Tell her you'll join her.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Can't you do your own dirty work?

420.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king smiles creepily and brandishes his weapon.

47.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
47.text: Say that again? 'Cause I know I didn't just hear you refuse the Absolute.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Fine, fine. I'll talk to Minthara.

153.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
153.text: Falling in line. Just what I like to see.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: You heard me. Talk to Minthara yourself.

367.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
367.text: I don't need your lip. Boys. Crush them.

439.speaker: Player
439.text: My oath is to take vengeance, not orders from some cultist god.

321.speaker: Player
321.text: It's a mistake. I'm a True Soul, remember? We connected.

233.speaker: Player
233.text: I'm a faithful True Soul. Did you not feel our connection?

141.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
141.text: Yeah, yeah - you're right. You're a real True Soul. I felt it.

268.speaker: Narrator
268.text: *Ragzlin's rage scorches your mind, hot and black. It squeezes you, suffocates you.*

223.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
223.text: I won't take this disrespect lying down. I'm the boss! I'm the Absolute's Right Hand!

103.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
103.text: What sorcery are you playing at? Boys - destroy them!

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *Your parasite resists, flailing as you crawl into Ragzlin's mindmurk.*

248.speaker: Narrator
248.text: *Rage slithers through him, hot and black. It squeezes you, suffocates you.*
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look angry.

242.speaker: Player
242.text: Correct. I took an oath to destroy monsters like you - and follow that oath I shall.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: Escape Ragzlin's mind and let him ask his own questions.

431.speaker: Narrator
431.text: *Another vision consumes you. A memory, seen through the creature's soul-dead eyes.*
431.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here

365.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
365.text: That can't be... Wait. Hold on.

204.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
204.text: That's all you've got? Tell me what the killer looks like!

352.speaker: Narrator
352.text: *Another vision. You see a clawed hand open a holding pod...*

277.speaker: Narrator
277.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod to reveal... darkness.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Doubt clouds Ragzlin's skull. Does he feel your guidance?*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised once more by words he didn't expect...*
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

389.speaker: Narrator
389.text: *Again, visions flow through you - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

308.speaker: Narrator
308.text: *It is like fireworks in your skull. His trust is quickly waning.*

388.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
388.text: You. Gith! What d'you know about this dead squiddie?

287.speaker: Player
287.text: None would dare deceive the Absolute's Right Hand.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I don't know anything, but I'll have your head if you ask again.

118.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
118.text: All right, all right. I shouldn't have questioned a True Soul like that.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: I'm a True Soul as well. How would I know more than you do?

198.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
198.text: I am the Absolute's Right Hand. I will stand for no lies!

280.speaker: Player
280.text: I know it's about to be joined by a dead hobgoblin.

299.speaker: Narrator
299.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised by words he didn't expect...*
299.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

239.speaker: Narrator
239.text: *Another vision. You look back into the darkness of the pod aboard the nautiloid...*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *...and the murk clears to reveal a face. Yours.*

193.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
193.text: Tell me who killed you, freak. No games!

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod. The murk clears to reveal a face. Yours.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Ragzlin frowns in confusion at a question he would never have asked.*
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look susprised here.

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *Then the creature speaks in visions: curved drow blades, crude goblin torches, gnoll teeth dripping blood.*

329.speaker: Narrator
329.text: *You see other mind flayers arranged in a serene circle. Absolute unity. Absolute power.*
329.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

73.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
73.text: Damn it. That tells me nothing!

276.speaker: Narrator
276.text: *You feel Ragzlin's suspicions. He'd never have asked about his Master. You remain in control - barely.*

111.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
111.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

315.speaker: Narrator
315.text: *Ragzlin scowls, shocked by his own words, and a jolt shoots through your skull.*
315.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look surprised here.

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *The creature speaks in visions - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*
252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

258.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
258.text: Gith on the hunt. They know something...

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *He is suspicious, confused by the question that fell from his lips. You proceed carefully...*

212.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
212.text: Talk to me, freak. Who killed you?

373.speaker: Narrator
373.text: *The memory fades, and the corpse awaits the next question.*

419.speaker: Player
419.text: Let the hobgoblin continue the questioning.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Penetrate Ragzlin's mind and take control.

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Ragzlin's thoughts roil, then still. Your words will be his.*

259.speaker: Narrator
259.text: *You navigate carefully. With Ragzlin's voice, you ask...*

339.speaker: Narrator
339.text: *Ragzlin continues the interrogation, oblivious to your attempts to sway him.*

369.speaker: Narrator
369.text: *Ragzlin's mind resists your penetration. He speaks his first question.*

379.speaker: Player
379.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I speak for the untamed wild - and I say enough. This ends here.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: It seems to me you've got an audience already.

443.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
443.context: NodeContext: Bordering on anger at your resistance to joining the relgious ceremony. Should sound creepy.

7.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
7.text: And there's no True Soul yet who turned their back on the Absolute.

181.speaker: Narrator
181.text: *You realise that the weapon the hobgoblin speaks of is the artefact you carry. You cannot let them discover it - no matter what.*
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH avatar glances down at her side (as if towards where the box is) then back to Dror

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the Absolute's clutches.*
210.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up, eyes flick over to Dror Ragzlin

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Settle in to watch the proceedings.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Scroll, incense... Do you mean to speak with this corpse?

75.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
75.text: Damn right - I'm gonna make this carcass talk.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: No, but I'll happily leave it a dead hobgoblin for company.

421.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
421.text: If it isn't another True Soul.

370.speaker: Wyll
370.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll looks at the mind flayer corpse
